alert.note: Alert for Saginaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 7:18PM EST until January 29 at 10:37PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Detroit/Pontiac MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Cass River At Frankenmuth affecting Saginaw County. .A rapid rise in the river Saturday is likely a result of an ice jam downstream. Expect levels to remain elevated until ice breaks up and moves out of the area. River level fluctuations of 1 to 3 feet are possible. For the Cass River...including Cass City, Vassar, Frankenmuth... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cass River at Frankenmuth. * WHEN...From this evening to late Monday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM EST Saturday the stage was 18.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Impact...At 17.0 feet, The river begins to overflow its banks in places, flooding adjacent low lands. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=DTX. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 1000 AM EST.
